docs.text: " saving silverman " is a good example of a good comedy gone bad .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: as a love story it is good , however as a comedy it falls flat on it's face .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i think throughout the short 90 minutes i laughed a total of seven times . . . and
docs.label: negative

docs.text: those were just chuckles at the most !
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the movie doesn't have the oomph to make it a great movie , and doesn't have the script to make it a funny movie .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: wayne lefessier ( steven zahn ) , j . d . mcnugent ( jack black ) , and darren silverman ( jason biggs ) have grown up all their lives together , they have been best friends forever and vow to stay close till the end .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: while in a bar after doing a show with their band , based on their love of neil diamond , darren meets a young woman named judith ( amanda peet ) whom he instantly falls for .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: wayne and j . d . however think differently and when judith tells darren that he can never see his friends again , it's up to wayne and j . d . to try and begin saving silverman .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the performances are topnotch and surprisingly , they are what keep the movie afloat .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: jason biggs right off the flop " loser " does an ok job playing silverman , but he is stale and flat at times .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: steve zahn is perfect in the role of wayne lefessier , and even though the movie is about silverman , lefessier is really the main character and the narrator of the movie itself .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: jack black is well jack black , and he does an all right job as j . d . but he isn't as funny as he has been in the past .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: amanda peet plays the ultimate bitch as judith , and neil diamond plays neil diamond ( he's better at singing than acting ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: anyway the performances in the film are good , but it's too bad the script isn't .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: speaking of script , hank nelkan's choppy script is not only badly written , but not funny enough even for an episode of sesame street .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the trailer for the movie , as with most movies gives away everything that happens in the movie , especially the funniest parts .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: somewhere " saving silverman " was meant to be a good movie , and it could have been , but alas in the end it wasn't .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: dennis dugan's direction is all right , he adds a few directorial touches here and there , nothing special being a simple comedy .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: " saving silverman " is a perfectly bad movie in more ways than one .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it has a great cast , a good director and a sweet story . . . it's
docs.label: negative

docs.text: just too bad it has a bad script and is all together a bad movie .
docs.label: negative
